title: Orrell Water Park Walking Route

images.title: Dave Green / Buttercup Meadow at Orrell Water Park
images.caption: Buttercup Meadow at Orrell Water Park

images.title: By Rept0n1x [CC BY-SA 3.0  (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0 )], from Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Birdlife in the water

description: This park in the Orrell area of Greater Manchester includes two pretty reservoirs surrounded by attractive woodland and a buttercup meadow. There's nice easy footpaths to follow around the water with lots of wildlife to look out for on the way. To extend the walk head south towards Longshaw to climb Billinge Hill. The hill is the highest point on Merseyside and only about a mile or so from the park. From the summit there's great views towards Great Orme in Wales, Blackpool tower, Greater Manchester, Winter Hill and the Derbyshire Peak District. You could also pick up the Leeds and Liverpool Canal and enjoy an easy towpath stroll on our Wigan Canal Walk. Here you can explore the lovely Wigan Flashes Nature Reserve where there's an abundance of water loving wildlife to see. The park is located only a few miles west of Wigan and the canal.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Rainford Walk starts from the village to the west of the park. It climbs to the nearby Billinge Hill before heading to the Water Park. There's a nice pub there for post walk refreshment as well. For more walking ideas in the area see the Merseyside Walks page.

display_address: Winstanley Road, Orrell Post, Far Moor, Wigan, Greater Manchester, England, WN5 7XD, United Kingdom
